title: json-schema for identification service reports
description: This is a schema definition for an identification report. This report is used to have a receipt to prove that an identificaton process was successfully accomplisched

reportID.title: Generic ID
reportID.description: Must be uniq to a single report. GUID is recommended here

serverIdentity.title: ServerIdentity
serverIdentity.description: This is a server id as software instance. This could be the server IP address, servername or the URL of the SAML endpoint providing this identity report (like ServerIdentity in XTA2 Version 4)

reportTime.title: Creation date of this report
reportTime.description: Datetime of the creation of this report (like ReportTime in XTA2 Version 4)

identificationDate.title: Identification Timestamp
identificationDate.description: Datetime of the identification process as stated in the original id statement

idStatus.title: Identification Status
idStatus.description: This is the value to indicate the status of the identification process. In case of failure the corresponding reason shall be stated in the idStatement attribute

idStatement.title: More details on identification outcome
idStatement.description: This is the error reason or some additional information in case of unknown or success situations. The corresponding message should be human understanable
examples: Error: requested LoA could not be found

subjectRef.title: SubjectRef
subjectRef.description: This should be a short link to the subject authenticated. Currently supported: firstName and lastName

contextInformation.title: Context Information provided by the service
contextInformation.description: The element corresponds to the TransactionContext in BSI TR-03130 which MAY be used to transmit context information like an ID or a hash. To have a link between this identification report and the service for which the identification process was started

documentReferences.title: can be used to link specific documents to an identification process
documentReferences.description: This element can contain references to documents including their hashes. This is an optional attribut.

loaSent.title: Level of assurance received
loaSent.description: in eIDAS contexts an id scheme (if it is notified) has a known LoA. When used in a national context only the values from the authority bsi.bund.de SHALL be used, which correspond to the levels as defined in [TR-03107-1]. See also BSI TR-03130
